definition: surname Wei/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1066-221 BC), located in present day Henan and Hebei Provinces
to guard/to protect/to defend/abbr. for 衛生|卫生, hygiene/health/abbr. for 衛生間|卫生间, toilet

sentences.english: Tian Taiquan accompanied us to go to the Red Army Graveyard the next day.
sentences.chinese: 第二天田太權陪我們幾個去那個紅衛兵墓上看看。

sentences.english: Mao Zedong's Red Guards sometimes called themselves “new Boxers”.
sentences.chinese: 紅衛兵有時自稱“新義和團”。

sentences.english: Millions of radical youths came to be known around the world as the Red Guards
sentences.chinese: 數百萬激進的年輕人成爲世界廣爲知道的紅衛兵。

sentences.english: Its waitresses dress as Red Guards.
sentences.chinese: 它的店員穿的都像紅衛兵。

sentences.english: Red Guards swarmed there for ritual denunciations of Liu and his ilk.
sentences.chinese: 紅衛兵蜂擁而至，在此舉行儀式批判劉和劉的親屬。

sentences.english: Red Guards swarmed there for ritual denunciations of Liu and his ilk.
sentences.chinese: 無數紅衛兵在這裏給劉及其同類人開批鬥大會。

sentences.english: If you didn't follow the Red Guards maybe one day they would criticize you.
sentences.chinese: 如果不追隨紅衛兵的話，或許有一天他們回來批鬥你。

sentences.english: Mao Zedong’s Red Guards sometimes called themselves “new Boxers”.
sentences.chinese: 紅衛兵有時自稱“新義和團”。

definition: to drag sb before a public meeting to denounce, humiliate and physically abuse them (esp. during the Cultural Revolution)
to parade sb through the streets/to march or parade in the streets
May Fourth Movement/Chinese national renewal movement that started with 4th May 1919 protest against the Treaty of Versailles
Destroy the Four Olds (campaign of the Cultural Revolution)
abbr. for 勞動改造|劳动改造[lao2 dong4 gai3 zao4]/reform through labor/laogai (prison camp)
to work in the fields (esp. young school-leavers)/forced agricultural experience for city intellectuals
fire of war everywhere (idiom); enveloped in the flames of war
